properties.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 1 at 10:17AM PST until February 2 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Hanford CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Fog will continue to lift in the San Joaquin Valley this
morning with improving visibilities. For the Wind Advisory,
northwest winds of 15 to 25 mph are likely Sunday afternoon and
evening with gusts of up to 35 mph.

* WHERE...The Southern San Joaquin Valley including the
Bakersfield area.

* WHEN...From noon to 10 PM PST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects.
Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may
result. Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highways affected include, but are not
limited to Highway 33, Highway 43, Highway 58, Highway 99,
Stockdale Highway and Interstate 5.
properties.instruction:
Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high
profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY IS NOW IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 10 PM PST SUNDAY... ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IS CANCELLED
